intro: Aegiphila serrata, commonly known as the serrated aegiphila, is a shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, serrated leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to violet. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
